title: Dataviz of the Month – Jun / July 2024
content:
Every month we pick and share some of our favourite infographics, visualisations and data stories. Here’s what we found in our work folders and around the web.

CREATED BY US

» How might the USA reach carbon net zero by 2050? Well, for a start: it’s ripe for solar power.
» What really increases average life expectancy? We let the science decide.
» As the plastics crisis grinds on, here are some vital plast-istics.
» How do I get my boyfriend/girlfriend to ____? Google’s auto-complete feature reveals the answer.

CREATED BY OTHERS

» Be glad you live now, and not in 1632, when many people simply died from… guess what? (unknown creator)
» The 4,000 year evolution of the alphabet in one very cool graphic. (Useful Charts)
» The cleanest & safest sources of energy (Visual Capitalist)
» The World as 100 People: 17 can’t read and write. 13 have no access to clean water. (Jack Hagley)
» Who was around in 1493? A fascinating look at who (e.g. Michelangelo ) was a contemporary of whom (e.g. Copernicus) (Jan Willem Tulp)
